dmca.title: [ABUSE] Report of piracy on your server.]
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Friday, June 24, 2005 12:45 PM
To: support@thirstype.com; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Report of piracy on your server.]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.


- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Report of piracy on your server.
Date: Fri, 24 Jun 2005 13:05:29 -0400
From: Thirstype support <support@thirstype.com>
To: abuse@theplanet.com, copyright@theplanet.com
CC: lemon@adobe.com, info@fontbureau.com

Dear sirs.
Please be informed that a website hosted on your server is egregiously
ignoring your Acceptable Use Policy.
The website "www.goodfonts.org" hosted at 70.84.185.18 is infringing the
following rule from your AUP:
"...This includes, but is not limited to, material protected by copyright,
trademark, trade secret, or other intellectual property rights; including
creating, utilizing, distributing unauthorized copies of software, or the
use of BitTorrent or other types of technologies utilized in the
distribution of illegally copied materials.  If Customer copies, distributes
or installs software in defiance of the license agreement, Customer is
violating federal copyright law. Company will cooperate with all law
enforcement agencies in relation to alleged copyright infringement housed in
our datacenters."

The website in question is offering pirated software in the form of digital
font files, aka typefaces, which are copyright protected.

One of the fonts co-published by my company, "Commerce" has been renamed
"Apanage" and posted for download on this page: http://
www.goodfonts.org/sans/ Also on this page are fonts from Font Bureau, such
as Agency FB, Berlin Sans FB; neither of which is hiding its provenance.
On another page - http://www.goodfonts.org/display/ - one can download fonts
published by Adobe Systems: "Krypta" and "Lithograph".
On many pages one can download fonts with the "MT" suffix which indicates
that the fonts in question are published by Agfa Monotype.

According to whois, the site is registered to "Franz Ferdinand" of
Williamsburg NY:
http://www.networksolutions.com/en_US/whois/
results.jhtml;jsessionid=IRQCHDGJXNFWSCWMEAQSFFA?
whoistoken=2&_requestid=58495

I am asking you to disable this website, as it flagrantly traffics in
pirated software material, and in so doing infringes upon ThePlanet's AUP.
(Not to mention breaking several international laws governing the
distribution of copyrighted material.)

Thanking you in advance for your attention to this matter.

Chester Jenkins
Thirstype

/ / / / / / / / / / / /   /      /            /                    /

chester / Thirstype
http://www.thirstype.com/ / chester@thirstype.com

1.646.654.1506 / phone + fax
1.917.547.3826 / alternate phone

168 Second Ave #253 / New York NY 10003 USA / post

/ / / / / / / / / / / /   /      /            /                    /

Thirstype is the copyright of Village Type & Design LLC

/ / / / / / / / / / / /   /      /            /                    /



- --
Thanks,
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.2.5 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Thunderbird - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFCvEawvK/XpJs6oyURAvI0AJ98JcK8NdgWSZAbmyzc5RLm9bIYUgCfVAAj
km44brcWgTL73S+RbItNt2w=
=lqHm
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
